Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Hey! Hey hey! I'm with you, right?

Speaker: chrissie
Dialogue: C'mon!

Speaker: chrissie
Dialogue: Tommy? Don't dunk me...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: How come the sun didn't used to shine in here?

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: 'cause when we bought the house it was Autumn. This is summer. Feed the dogs.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Do you see the kids?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Probably out in the back yard.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: In Amity, you say 'Yahd.'

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: The kids are in the yahd, playing near the cah. How's that sound?

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Like you're from N'Yawk.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Give me 30 years, I'll get it.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Did you burn another kettle? Y'know you're a fire hazard? This is the third one!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Feed the dogs.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: You want to go through those?  I'm taking them to the Thrift Shop. It's Marcia Vaughn's pet charity. Pick out what you want to keep -- it's mostly your city clothes.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Ship it.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Don't be silly - You're going to make summer better for them...

Speaker: michael
Dialogue: Cut my hand. Hit by a vampire.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: On the swing? I told you not to play near there until I sanded it down.  See what your son did?

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Go upstairs and bring Mommy a band- aid.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Don't forget these.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Oh, yeah.  How do I look? Older, huh?

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: I think they make you look sexy.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Sexy, hm? What was I before?

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Older, sillier.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I don't want to depend on these things, y'know - sometimes you can weaken your eyes.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Let's see...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Brody... yeah, what's up... mmm... Well, what do they usually do, float or wash up? Really?... okay, I'll meet both of you at the beach in  First goddamn weekend of the summer.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: There.  What was that?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: The office.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Be careful.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Here? You gotta be kiddin'.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Love ya.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Hey Chief. Bring my cup back.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Christine what?

Speaker: cassidy
Dialogue: Worthingsly... Worthington -- no one ever died on me before.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You picked her up on the ferry.

Speaker: cassidy
Dialogue: I didn't know her.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: And nobody else saw her in the water?

Speaker: cassidy
Dialogue: Somebody could've -- I was sort of passed out.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Think she might've run out on you?

Speaker: cassidy
Dialogue: Oh, no, sir. I've never had a woman do that. I'm sure she drowned.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You from around here?

Speaker: cassidy
Dialogue: No. Cambridge. Harvard. My family's in Tuxedo, New York, though.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You here for the summer?

Speaker: cassidy
Dialogue: Some friends and me took a house.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What d'you pay for a place just for the summer?

Speaker: cassidy
Dialogue: A thousand apiece, something like that. There's five of us. And we each kick in a hundred a week for beer and cleaning, stuff like that.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Pretty stiff.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Maybe that's your girl.

Speaker: cassidy
Dialogue: You can't make me look -- !

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: If this is going to work, you've got to keep current stuff out here, and put 'closed' files in there. The 'Pendings' stay on my desk, okay?

Speaker: polly
Dialogue: This is in no order of importance, Chief: There's a meeting on the Amity Town Council on Aging this Monday night, Bentoncourt Hall. The Fire Inspector wants you to go over the fireworks site with him before he catches the one o'clock ferry. Mainly, you have a batch of calls about that new Karate school.

Speaker: polly
Dialogue: Searle's Rent-a-Bike, the Rainy Ale, Tisberry's Hardware... they say it's those nine-year-olds from the school practicing karate on all those nice picket fences.

Speaker: polly
Dialogue: It's the Coroner. Somebody pass away in the night?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Jesus, Santos.

Speaker: polly
Dialogue: What's the matter?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Polly, I want to know what water recreation is on for today.

Speaker: polly
Dialogue: Right this minute?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Where'd you hide the 'Beach Closed' signs?

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: We never had any. What's the problem?

Speaker: local merchant
Dialogue: Glad I caught you. There's a city truck with New Hampshire plates parked right in front of my...

Speaker: keisel
Dialogue: Glasses, right?

Speaker: keisel
Dialogue: Look at those fences! Little guys about eight to ten years old. And look at this!

Speaker: keisel
Dialogue: They did that with their bare hands.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Call me later in the day, okay, Harry?

Speaker: lynwood
Dialogue: Stuff's no good to me in August when the Pilgrims come in June...  Go on and help yourself to whatever you need, Chief. Can you work the register?

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: Polly told me to tell you there's a scout troop in Avril Bay doing the mile swim for their Merit Badges. I couldn't call them in, there's no phone out there.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Get out of there  take these back to the office and make up some 'Beach Closed' signs, and let Polly do the printing.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: What's the matter with my printing?

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: What have you got there, Lenny?

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: We had a shark attack at South Chop this morning, Mayor. Fatal. Gotta batten down the beach.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Who've you told this to, Lenny?

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: I just found out about it -- but there's a bunch of Boy Scouts in the water a coupla miles down the coast from where we found the girl. Avril Bay, thereabouts. Chief went to dry them off.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: You come with us, Lenny.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: I've got all these signs here...

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: C'mon, it'll give us time to think about what they're going to say.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Martin!  Are you going to shut down the beach on your own authority?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Do I need any more authority?

Speaker: meadows
Dialogue: Technically, you need the instruction of a civic ordinance, or a special meeting of the town selectmen...

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: That's just going by the book. We're just a little anxious that you're rushing into something serious here. This is your first summer.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Now tell me something I don't know.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: All I'm saying is that Amity is a summer town -- we need summer dollars, and if they can't swim here, they'll use the beaches at Cape Cod, or Long Island.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: So we should set out a smorgasbord?

Speaker: meadows
Dialogue: We're not even sure what it was.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What else could've done that?

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Boat propeller?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: I think, possibly... sure. A boating accident.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Some weekend tramp accidentally goes swimming too far, she's a little drunk, a fishing boat comes along --

Speaker: meadows
Dialogue: Remember when Fred Ganz went scalloping in his BVD's? He was going to swim to New Bedford, he said.

Speaker: meadows
Dialogue: ...and Bill Mayhew almost caught him in his net...?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Doctor, you're the one who told me what it was!

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: I was wrong. We'll have to amend the report.

Speaker: meadows
Dialogue: We never had that kind of trouble here.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: I don't think you can appreciate the gut reaction people have to these things.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I was only reacting to what I was told.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: It's all psychological, anyway. You yell 'Barracuda' and everyone says 'huh'. You yell 'Shark' and we've got a panic on our hands. I think we all agree we don't need a panic this close to the 4th of July.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I can't work in a vacuum. Why don't you make Hendricks Chief? His family's been here since the Puritans -- half this island are his cousins.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Martin, we hired the best man we could find.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: We need someone who isn't prejudiced by old feuds or family ties, someone who can referee things.

Speaker: meadows
Dialogue: You have our complete support.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Now then. We've got a vandalism problem we ought to talk about...

Speaker: shopkeeper
Dialogue: Hello, Mr. Quint.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Four spools of Number 12 piano wire, Okay? I ordered them.

Speaker: shopkeeper
Dialogue: Yessir, right here. What do those fish do, eat this stuff?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: They choke on it.

Speaker: shopkeeper
Dialogue: Bye now.

Speaker: max taft
Dialogue: Looks like another big season. Gets worse every year.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: taft
Dialogue: Present company excepted, but off- islanders are a pain in the butt. Pardon my French.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: What about this kid? What if he were born here. That make him an islander?

Speaker: taft
Dialogue: Just 'cause a cat has kittens in an oven, it don't make them muffins.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: I'm not a muffin! I'm a boy!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Water. Just once more, please?

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Do you want the boys to come in? Honey, if you're worried...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: How's the water?

Speaker: keisel
Dialogue: Too cold. I'm going in again Labor Day. Hope we get this weather next weekend.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: You're very tight, y'know?  Right there.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Ow.  He's gotta be more careful in the water...

Speaker: dog man
Dialogue: Buster! Hey, Buster! Here boy!  He continues to ad lib calling his dog, but there's no answer, no dog in the water.

Speaker: tourist
Dialogue: Something in the water. Right there! Didn't anyone see it?

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: There's blood in the water.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: What is it...?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Michael! Sean! Out of the water. Everybody out of the water! Michael! Get out!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Look, I've got to talk to her. This isn't a contest we want the whole country entering.

Speaker: meadows
Dialogue: I agree. If she's going to advertise, I wouldn't recommend out-of-town papers. Amity people could take care of this.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I'm responsible for public safety around here...

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Then go out tomorrow and make sure no one gets hurt.  Everybody, could I have your attention? Since this affects all of us, I suggest we move into council chambers, where there's more room...

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Well, here we all are; anyone have any special questions?

Speaker: denherder
Dialogue: Is that $3000 bounty on the shark in cash or check?

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: That's private business between you brave fishermen and Mrs. Kintner.  -- Chief --

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I'd like to tell you what we're doing so far. These are some of the steps I've taken as Chief of Police...

Speaker: meadows
Dialogue: What's going on with the beaches, Chief?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I'll get to that in a minute. First, I plan to start our seasonal summer help early, and to use shark spotters on beaches open to the sea. I'd like cooperation from local fishermen, and I've also contacted the Oceanographic Institute over on the mainland.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: No need to involve outsiders in our business, Martin.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Are you going to close the beaches?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Larry and I have also decided to close the beaches for a short time.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Only 24 hours!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I didn't agree to that!

Speaker: mrs. taft
Dialogue: The motel is all I own -- you pull the plug on this town and I go down the drain with it.

Speaker: mr. posner
Dialogue: Nobody's seen a shark.

Speaker: mr. polk
Dialogue: We'll lose business, we lose taxes, we lose our shirts!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: I'll find him for three. But I'll kill him for ten.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: I'm gonna kill this thing... just a matter of whether I do it now -- or at the end of summer.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Thank you very much, Mr. Quint, the Selectmen will take your offer under advisement

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Can you stand something to eat?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Love a cup of tea. With lemon.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Mikey loves his birthday present.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Where is he?

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: He's sitting in it.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Honey. He has it tied up to the jetty with a double-knot.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Son! -- Out of the water now!

Speaker: michael
Dialogue: My boat's neat, dad!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I want him out of the ocean.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: It's three feet deep, Martin

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Michael! Come inside!

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: It's his birthday present, and you closed the beach, Honey. I told him not to go in the water after what happened yesterday. I don't believe he'll ever do it again.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I told him not to go out until he memorized the handbook and the safety safety regulations, until he was sure of himself...

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: You heard your father! Out right now!

Speaker: denherder
Dialogue: You wanna call it a night after here?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: It's only two-thirty. What, are you tired?

Speaker: denherder
Dialogue: Yeah, Charlie, I got my second wind three nibbles back.

Speaker: denherder
Dialogue: Leg of lamb this time?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Screw lamb -- let's shoot the sirloin!

Speaker: denherder
Dialogue: We're blowin' half the bounty on bait --

Speaker: denherder
Dialogue: One more after this, then I'm going home.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Set?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Tide's taking it right out.

Speaker: denherder
Dialogue: You do this all the time, right, Charlie?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Twenty years.

Speaker: denherder
Dialogue: I can't believe that people pay money to go fishing. This is really dumb. This isn't even relaxing... it's just boring.

Speaker: denherder
Dialogue: Hey! What's this?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Look at him take it!

Speaker: denherder
Dialogue: Do I set the goddam hook?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Let him do it! Go-go-go-go-go!

Speaker: denherder
Dialogue: CHARLIE! JUMP!

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Holy Jesus Christ!

Speaker: denherder
Dialogue: Get the hell out! Charlie! Swim!

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: ...So then Denherder and Charlie sat there trying to catch their breath, and figuring out how to explain to Charlie's wife what happened to her freezer full of meat.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: That wasn't funny.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: Mrs. Kintner must've put her ad in Field and Stream.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Looks more like the readers of the National Enquirer.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Hey! You know how many men that's supposed to hold?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What you got ain't safe. You take some guys off or you don't go out.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Hello.

Speaker: gardner
Dialogue: Hello, back.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You going out too, Ben?

Speaker: gardner
Dialogue: Might give it a try. That three thousand bounty beats working for a living.  We ready?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Just back up! No, the other way! Cut it to your left! Your other left! The big boat, your front end is out way too far. Little boat, stay still!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Ahoy, sail! You got an oar? Well, scull it out!

Speaker: sailboat skipper
Dialogue: Tell that stinkpotter to belay!

Speaker: motorboat skipper
Dialogue: Tell that ragsetter I'm going to poke him in the snoot!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Just cast off in turn and make for the channel, OK?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Excuse me, I wonder if you could tell me...

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Is that dynamite?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: If that's dynamite, give it here, or don't leave port.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Aw, c'mon, it's just fireworks. Sharks like fireworks, it attracts them.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Hand it over.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: There's a fantail launch out there that won't make it beyond the breakwater.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You're tellin' me. I swear, this town has gone crazy.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Officer, I wonder if you could tell me where I could find Chief Brody?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Who are you?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Hooper, Matt Hooper. From the Oceanographic Institute.

Speaker: pratt
Dialogue: Well, get over there! He ain't caught it yet!

Speaker: pratt
Dialogue: Hand me that pole! Quick!

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Beat it! I hooked him!

Speaker: pratt
Dialogue: How's the family, Harry?  Go on and do it!

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Let go my shark!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Let's show Mr. Hooper our accident.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Victim One, identified as Christine Watkins, female Caucasian...

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: ...height and weight may only be estimated from partial remains. Torso severed in mid-thorax, eviscerated with no major organs remaining. May I have a drink of water? Right arm severed above the elbow with massive tissue loss from upper musculature. Portions of denuded bone remaining.  -- did you notify the coast guard?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: No, it was local jurisdiction.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Left arm, head, shoulders, sternum and portions of ribcage intact.  -- Did you go out in a boat and look around?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: No, we just checked the beach...

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: It wasn't an 'accident,' it wasn't a boat propeller, or a coral reef, or Jack the Ripper. It was a shark. It was a shark.

Speaker: meadows
Dialogue: Ginny, get this out on the state wire to AP and UPI in Boston and New York. Have one of them pick it up for the national and call Dave Axelrod in New York and tell him this is from me and he owes me one... let's get a picture.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Well, if one man can catch a fish in 50 days, then I guess 50 of these bozos can catch a fish in one day -- beginner's luck.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You did it! Did Ben Gardner catch this?

Speaker: meadows
Dialogue: Okay, everybody, I want to get a picture for the paper -- could everyone clear out of the way?

Speaker: meadows
Dialogue: Could you get out of the shot, young man?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Who, me? Okay...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Larry, if you'd see these clowns leave, you'd never believe they'd come back with anything. But they got him!

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: That's good. That's real good. Ben Meadows getting pictures for the paper.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Sure he is.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Who's that young man?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Matt Hooper, the specialist they send down from the Oceanographic Institute.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: I think we all owe a debt of gratitude to these men for catching this monster.

Speaker: pratt
Dialogue: Whadya mean, 'Bite Radius?' What's that?

Speaker: gaffer
Dialogue: Teeth are teeth, right?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I didn't say this wasn't the shark, I just said I wasn't sure this was the one...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What d'ya mean?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: There are hundreds of different kinds of sharks; makos, blues, hammerheads, white-tips... any one of them could've attacked. Look -- shark digestion is slow. We could open this one up, and find whatever he's been eating is still inside.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: That's disgusting! This is the largest, meanest, most vicious shark ever landed off Amity Island, and a known maneater!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Let's just cut him open and see what's inside...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Why not, Larry? We could get a positive confirmation that way.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Be reasonable, boys -- this isn't the time or the place to do some kind of half-assed autopsy on a fish. Ben...  do you have all the pictures you need?

Speaker: meadows
Dialogue: Plenty.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Wait a minute...

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Chief, I'll take responsibility for this. Boys, cut this ugly sonofabitch down before he stinks up the whole island. Harve, tomorrow you and Carl take him out and dump him right in the drink.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Martin. She's in a sick, terrible state.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Look, maybe this is the wrong time to pursue this, but I'm not sure...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: She's right.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Let's all get out of here, this place stinks.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I'm going home.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: C'mere and give Daddy a kiss.

Speaker: sean
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Because he needs it.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Hi. I'm Matt Hooper. If your husband is here, I'd like to talk to him.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: So would I. Come on in.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Would you like something? Some coffee?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Is anyone having this...?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Dynamite!  How was your day...?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Swell.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Here... one red, one white.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Ummm. Really good.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: My husband tells me you're in sharks.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I wouldn't put it that way. But I love sharks.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: You love sharks?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I do.  But you've still got a problem here, there's a shark just off the island somewhere.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: How come you have to tell them that?

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Excuse me, but what are you talking about? Didn't they catch the shark this afternoon? It was on the Cape station news.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: They caught a shark, not the shark. Big difference. I could've proved it this afternoon, by cutting that one open and examining his stomach contents. Also, his bite was too small.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I was lucky to find that in town -- it's an estate bottled vintage year...

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: We ought to let it breathe... Whatever.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Let's all have a drink.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You too, sweetheart...

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Here's to your husband, the only other rational man on the island. Day after tomorrow, I'll be gone, and he'll be the only one.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: You're leaving?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Going out on the 'Aurora.'

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Is that a boat?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Is it! The best-funded research expedition to ever study the shark... around the world in 18 months.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Like those Cousteau specials on television? I think it's for the kids, but I love them.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Better than Cousteau, or Compagno with computers, telemetry, Defense Department funding...

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: I saw a show with sea otters, and a big turtle... Mikey loved it. Made me promise to get him one. Will you live on the boat?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Yep.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Martin hates boats. Hates the water. On the ferry to the mainland, he sits in the car the whole way over. He's got this childhood thing, there's a clinical word for it.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Drowning. Lemme ask you something. Is it true most attacks take place in three feet of water, around 10 feet from the beach?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Yeah. Like the kid on your beach. I wish I could've examined that shark they caught...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Something else. Do most attacks go unreported?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: About half of them. A lot of 'missing swimmers' are really shark victims.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: There's a kind of a lone shark, called, uh...

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Rogue?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Yeah. Rogue. Picks out an area where there's food and hangs out there as long as the food supply lasts?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: It's called Territoriality. It's a theory.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: And before 1900, when people first starting swimming for recreation, before public bathing and resorts, there were very few shark attacks, cause sharks didn't know what they were missing?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: You could say that.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Why don't we have one more drink, you and I, and then we go down and cut open that old shark and see for sure what's inside him, or not.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Can you do that?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I am Chief of Police. I can do anything I want.  You want to come?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I'm flattered you should ask.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: ...And it was Dartmouth Winter weekend, and she was Homecoming Queen, and I was her date; then she got into the fact that her family had more money than my family, and she was right -- her great-grandfather was in mining, and my ancestors were Yankee shipbuilders. So we broke up and I went home with some beatnik from Sarah Lawrence.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What stinks so bad?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Our friend, the shark.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: We always had a summer place on the water -- Newport, the Vineyard, so I figured I'd major in something I knew about. Oceanography, marine biology. It was that, or design racing yachts like my older brother. Hmmm. He we go. Up the old alimentary canal. Hold the light.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: We open the abdominal cavity and check the digestive tract. Simple.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Half a flounder. Hmmm... a burlap bag... a paint can... aha!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What? What?!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Just as I thought. He drifted up here with the Gulf Stream, from southern waters.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: How can you tell?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Florida license plate.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: He ate a car?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: No, but Tiger sharks are the garbage cans of the ocean. They eat anything. But this one didn't eat any people. There's nothing here...

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: ...Nothing.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What do we do?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: If you're looking for a shark, you don't look on land. You go out and chum for him.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Chum?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Only one sure way to find him -- offer him a little something to eat. Chum -- blood, waste meat, fish, anything. They can sense it miles away. If he's out there, we might be able to get a closer look at him.  It's a good time, too. They're night feeders...

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: That's the Cape Light -- we're on the stretch where he's feeding, if he's still here.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What is all this stuff?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: And two loose nuts behind the wheel.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Can you tell from that if a big man- eater is around?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Sometimes.  Look here -- something big, probably a school of mackerel clumped together. And staying right with us.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Where'd you get all this?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I Bought it.  Both sets of grandparents set up trust funds for me; stocks went up, so I don't have to touch my principal.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You're at the Institute full time? Or do you have a job?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: It is a job. I'm not fooling around like some amateur. It's my life!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: We gotta get back soon...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What the hell?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: That's Ben Gardner's boat! It's the Flicka! Ben? Ben!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I want to check something. Hold my feet.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Don't they have lifejackets or something? An extra boat?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: They must've hit something.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: He didn't have a dinghy aboard. I'm going down to take a look at his hull.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Why don't we just tow it in?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: We will. There's something I've got to find out.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Be careful, for chrissake.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You all right?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: A White! A Great White, I found a tooth buried in the hull. He must've attacked... I knew it... Gardner's dead in there. I didn't see the mate...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: No shark did that to a boat!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Jesus Christ! A Great White! Who'd believe it! We're not talking about a shark, we're talking about a Shark!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: There is a kind of shark called a Great White Shark that every expert in the world agrees is a maneater.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: You're situation here suggests that a Great White has staked out a claim in the waters around Amity Island, and that he will continue to feed here as long as there is food in the water.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: There's no limits to where he can strike, and we've had three attacks and two deaths in the past few days. It happened like this before, in 1916, when a Great White killed five swimmers at Jones Beach, in Long Island.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: A shark's attack is stimulated by the kind of splashing and activity that occurs whenever humans go swimming -- you can't avoid it!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: A 4th of July beach is like ringing a dinner bell, for Chrissake!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I just pulled a shark tooth the size of a shot glass out of the hull of a wrecked boat out there.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: We towed Ben Gardner's boat in, Larry; he was dead and his boat was all chewed up.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Is that tooth here? Did anyone see it?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I don't have it.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: He lost it on the way up.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: What kind of a shark did you say it was?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Carcaradon carcharias. A Great White.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Well, I'm not going to commit economic suicide on that flimsy evidence. We depend on the summer people for our lives, and if our beaches are closed, then we're all finished.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: We have got to close the beaches. We have got to get someone to kill the shark, we need non-corrosive mesh netting, we need scientific support... It's gonna cost money just to keep the nuts out and save what we have.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: I don't thing either of you is familiar with our problems...

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I'm familiar with the fact that you are going to ignore this thing until it swims up and bites you on the ass! There are only two ways to solve this thing: you can kill it, or you can cut off its food supply...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: That means closing the beaches.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Come here, I want to show you something.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Sick vandalism! Brody, that's a deliberate mutilation of a public service message! I want those little paint-happy bastards caught and hung up by their baby Buster Browns!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: That's it! I'm standing here arguing with a guy who can't wait to be a hot lunch. Goodbye.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Wait a minute! I need you.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Out there is a Perfect Engine, an Eating Machine that is a miracle of evolution -- it swims and eats and that's all. Look at that! Those proportions are correct.  I know sharks.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: You'd love to prove that. Getting your name in the National Geographic.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Larry, we can re-open the beaches in August.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: August! Tomorrow is the 4th of July, and we are going to open for business. It's going to be our best summer in years. If you're so concerned about the beaches, you two, you do whatever you have to to keep them safe, but with you or without you, the beaches stay open this weekend.

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: Martin Brody?  I'll need your signature here... here... and here.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What is this?

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: Authorization for direct payment of flight expenses not directly connected to a normal mission of this command.  You pay for the gas.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I signed on the wrong line...

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: Just erase your signature and initial your erasure.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I want to thank you guys from local agencies for cooperating, and I hope we won't actually be needing your services. But I'm glad to have you here.

Speaker: ensign
Dialogue: I want to get our lines and repellent out, so we better shove off.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: We're all on one channel, so let's keep radio traffic to a minimum, okay?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I hope we get some more help.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I wish it would rain...

Speaker: tv director
Dialogue: Put 1 on the line. In five. 4. 3. 2.

Speaker: announcer
Dialogue: ...and with me is the Mayor of Amity, Lawrence Vaughn. Mr. Vaughn, how about those rumors?

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: How about them indeed. I'm pleased and happy to repeat the news that we have, in fact, caught and killed a large predator that supposedly injured some bathers here. As you can see, it's a beautiful day, the beaches are open, and the folks here are having a wonderful time. Amity, y'know, means 'Friendship.'

Speaker: announcer
Dialogue: Also here today is a Marine Biologist and Research Fellow from the Oceanographic Institute, Matthew Hooper. Mr. Hooper, what've you heard?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: What I've heard and what I've seen are two different things. I believe there is a large Great White Shark -- Carcharodon Cacharias - in the waters off this very beach, that he has killed and that he will kill again...

Speaker: announcer
Dialogue: And there you have it -- two different opinions, by men of good will. The holiday crowd here at Amity seems to be making up its own mind...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I'm sorry, I just don't have the time.

Speaker: tv director
Dialogue: Recue the machines. 2, pan off the Chief and show me some tits and ass. 1, get me some cute kids. 3... see if you got a shot at the water.

Speaker: assistant director
Dialogue: Mayor, 43 seconds, Biologist 45 seconds. That's equal time, right?

Speaker: director
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: director
Dialogue: Close enough for remote.

Speaker: director
Dialogue: Think we ought to stick around?

Speaker: announcer
Dialogue: What else you got?

Speaker: assistant director
Dialogue: Teachers' strike downtown.

Speaker: director
Dialogue: That's five minutes, guys. Coffee.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Why don't you get in the water?

Speaker: selectman
Dialogue: I don't want to wash off my suntan lotion. I'll get a burn...

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Nobody's going in!

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Is there nobody going in? What a shame. Arthur, should I be going in?

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: It's very nice. Not too cold... Quite refreshing... Very pleasant....

Speaker: arthur
Dialogue: No sharks, m'lady.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: This is marvelous! Arthur, I want to come back to this very spot. Will you make a note of where we are?

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: Anything? Thought I saw a shadow. Over.

Speaker: copter spotter
Dialogue: Nothing from up here, Daisy. Over.

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: False alarm. Must be this glare.

Speaker: voices
Dialogue: Who's scared to go in! I was in! Up to your knees, yeah -- So come with me -- I'll go again.

Speaker: meadows
Dialogue: Beautiful day, Chief!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Hey Mikey -- !

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You're not going to the ocean with that, are you son?

Speaker: michael
Dialogue: I'm all checked out for light surf and look at it.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Do me this favor just once. Use the ponds.

Speaker: michael
Dialogue: Dad, the ponds are for old ladies.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Just a favor for your old man.

Speaker: michael
Dialogue: Sure, Dad.

Speaker: copter spotter
Dialogue: Copter to Daisy! Red Four, Red Four!

Speaker: hendricks
Dialogue: Where -- ?

Speaker: copter spotter
Dialogue: Went under your -- There!

Speaker: sonar operator
Dialogue: Jesus Christ -- Shark!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Everybody out! Out of the water, please -- leave the water, please --

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: No whistles! No whistles!

Speaker: tv director
Dialogue: Why did we wrap? Get that! Somebody get that!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Block the estuary! The estuary!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: He's in shock. Get blankets!

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: The doctor said it's okay -- mild shock. He can come home in the morning.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Hey, big guy -- you want anything from home?

Speaker: michael
Dialogue: My cars. And a comic book.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Take him home.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Home... New York?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: No. Home here.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Got a pen on you?

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: There's only one thing you're good for anymore -- signing a damn voucher. Here. It's an authorization to employ a contractor.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: I don't know if I can do that without a...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I'm going to hire Quint to kill the fish. I want to see that shark dead.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: Maybe we can save August...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Forget it. This summer's had it. Next summer's had it. You're the mayor of Shark City. You wanted to keep the beaches open. What happens when the town finds out about that?

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: I was acting in the town's best interests...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: The best interest in this town would be to see that fish belly-up in the water with a hole in his head. You do the right thing. You authorize me.  Right there. Whatever it costs.

Speaker: vaughn
Dialogue: My kids were on that beach...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Just sign it, Larry.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: This has got to be one big violation...

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: This is quite a place.

Speaker: quint's voice
Dialogue: Keep your hands off my stuff.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Did you bring a check?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Cash? Or do we do this on a handshake and a promise?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I'm authorized by the township of Amity to hire you as an independent contractor. We'll meet your price.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: And my regular daily rate -- $200, whether we catch him or not.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You got it.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: And incidental damages, if any...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You got it.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: And you get the Mayor off my back with this zoning crap. Nobody tells me how to run my property.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You got it.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: And, uh, a case of apricot brandy and you buy the lunch.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Two cases. And dinner when you land.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Try some of this. I made it myself.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Here's to swimmin' with bowlegged women.

Speaker: herschel
Dialogue: Mr. Quint...

Speaker: herschel
Dialogue: I'm not goin'. No sir.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: You want to get paid, you go.

Speaker: herschel
Dialogue: Forget the money. You can't pay me enough. I ain't crazy. I worked some big mean fish with you, but I ain't goin' on this one.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: This is the last time I hear from you. I don't want anyone with piss for blood on my vessel. Put that blackfish on board, pump the bilges, and top off the fuel tanks, and finish up in the morning. Then you're on the beach.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: You're going to need an extra hand...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: This is Matt Hooper...

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: I know who he is...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: He's from the Oceanographic Institute.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I've been to sea since I was 12. I've crewed three Trans-pacs --

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Transplants?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: -- and an America's Cup Trials...

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: I'm not talking about day sailing or pleasure boating. I'm talking about working for a living. Sharking.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: And I'm not talking about hooking some poor dogfish or sand shark. I'm talking about a Great White.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Are you now. I know about porkers in the water --  Here. Tie me a sheepshank.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I don't need to pass basic seamanship.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Let me see your hands...

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Ha. City hands. You been counting money. If you had a $5000 net and $2000 worth of fish in it, and along comes Mr. White, and makes it look like a kiddy scissors class has gone to work on it and made paper dolls. If you'd ever worked for a living, you'd know what that means.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Look, I don't need to hear any of this working class hero crap. Some party boat skipper who's killed a few sharks...

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Hey. Knock it off. I don't want to have to listen to this while we're out there...

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: What do you mean 'We...?'

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: It's my charter. My party.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: All right, Commissioner. But when we're on my ship, I am Master, Mate and Pilot. And I want him...  ...along for ballast.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You got it.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: 5 lengths of 1/2-inch, 20 number 14's, straight gaff, flying gaffs, tail rope, eye splice, M-1, 20 clips, pliers, irons...

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Powerhead, CO2 darts, hypo, regulator, tanks, depth gauge, camera, extra magazines, cage...

Speaker: assistant
Dialogue: You got everything you asked for?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: All of it. And thank Dr. Miro for me. And tell Borack I'll catch up with them in New Zealand.

Speaker: assistant
Dialogue: This is actually a killing expedition?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: An eye for an eye, you know.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Hey, Squirt! You want to stow this gear or you want me to use it for ballast? It ain't good for much but bait.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I'll see ya. Tell Dorothy hello.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Hello, Junior. What are you? Some kind of half-assed astronaut?  Jesus Christ, when I was a kid, every little squirt wanted to be a harpooner or a sword fisherman. What d'ya have there -- a portable shower?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Anti-Shark cage.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Who's inside, you or the shark?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: You're in the cage?  You're in the water with the shark.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Comin' aboard...

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Did you take your dramamine?  Here.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Hurry up, Chief, daylight's a wastin'.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: Is that him?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Colorful, isn't he?

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: You going to be all right?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Nothing to worry about -- I'll survive this.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: I'll see you back soon. There's an extra pair of glasses in your black socks, and there's some suntan lotion and blistex in your kit.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Yo-ho-ho and a bottle of rum.

Speaker: ellen
Dialogue: What'll I tell the kids?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Tell 'em I went fishin'!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Cast off the bow line! Now your stern!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: I'll throw your ass through that little round window.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Now hear this. You're aboard the fishing vessel 'Orca,' and I'm her Captain, Master, Mate, and Owner. You'll jump when I holler. We're doin' a job here, and Christ, I ain't got time to watch you birds get hooks in your ass and fall overboard. Ship with me, and you'll do all right. Cross me, and I'll slap you upside your heads. Now -- if you boys are ready -- let's go fishin'.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Here's something for you...

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: These greedy sons-a-bitches will eat their own guts.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Go ahead, you cannibals. Tell 'em where you got it!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: What's that supposed to prove?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Just a little appetizer. I want our porker to know we're serving. I want to put some iron into that big yap...

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Keep that chum line going -- we've got five good miles. Don't break it.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Who's driving the boat?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Nobody. We're drifting with the current.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Nothing. Nothing, nothing, nothing.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Hell, in the old days we went out with good charts, good sounding lead, and a damn good compass. Nowadays, these kids are afraid to go out without depth finders, radar, radio, electric toothbrush, every stupid thing...

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Get a fresh barrel.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Watch it! Compressed air -- you screw around with one of those and Boom! Careful, huh?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Next time, ask me.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: That's pilot whale, isn't it?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: It ain't a Big Mac.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Why are we way out here, when the shark's back there?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: ...'cause this is where he lives. You gotta think like they do.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Easy for you -- they got a brain the size of a radish.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Now if he weren't around, we'd of hooked something else by now, wouldn't we? But he scared 'em all away. Big lonesome son of a bitch...

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: -- he'll gulp it down now...  Hooooooo!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You got it?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Wet my reel, quick!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Starboard, for Chris'sake --

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Hey, you! Farmer! Half-speed there...

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Aye, Aye SIR. Stand by to repel boarders. Poop the mainsail. Argh, Jim Boy.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Where the hell is he going?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Oh, this ain't foolin' me --  Sure -- try it!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Makin' believe it's easy now.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Gettin' ready to run again -- no? No?  Let's see who's gonna tease who now!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Let it go, don't waste your time.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Down here, Hooper!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I don't know what it is, but it's not a shark.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Look -- you may be a big Yahoo in the lab, but out here you're just supercargo, and you'll do as I say, or you can take your gear and backstroke home. Now get down here!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: The wire's showing!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Grab the leader. He ain't normal, this one... they never --

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: It's too wild, too erratic. It's a marlin or a stingray. It's a gamefish.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Watch your hands --  Grab onto this!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: A marlin, or a stingray. Huh. Don't ever tell me my business again. Get back up on the bridge.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I'm okay...

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Fasten the pole.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What's the point with hooks and Lines? --

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Don't tell me my business!  Quarter-mile, that way. Full throttle.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: How -- if they're gonna keep on breaking?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: What I do is trick him to the surface, got that? Then I can jab him, understand?  Think I'm gonna haul it in as if he's a catfish, like everyone else does?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Over there!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: What do you see?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: At least you handle the boat all right. Stop. Here... Cut the engine.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: 20 feet, if it's an inch...

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: 25 feet. And three tons of him there.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: I never saw one that big.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What do we do? Get some help? Radio in?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: How're we gonna handle this?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Orca here.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Put her on.

Speaker: ellen's voice
Dialogue: ...push this? Oh. It's working. Hello, Martin?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: This is Quint, Missus.

Speaker: ellen's voice
Dialogue: I just wanted to know if you were all right... the Coast Guard let me use their radio. Is Chief Brody there?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: He's busy.

Speaker: ellen's voice
Dialogue: Well... is everything all right?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Just fine, Missus. We'll be back soon. Everything's fine. We haven't seen anything yet. Orca out.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Damn it! I need something in the foreground to give it some scale. Martin! Stand here! No, to your left!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Here. Rig this to the forward keg up there.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Get up there and steer her. Follow my hand, and hold 'er steady. I've got to get a clean shot at that porker's head.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Hurry up, rig the line!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Come to port. Watch my hand. Steady now...

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: The line, man, the line!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Get clear, damn you!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Clear!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Jesus H. Christ On a Crutch!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Now you've done it, you piss-ant. Stop and rig a goddam tinker toy to my gear. Let the bastard fight the keg for a while. He can't stay down with that on.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Rig another keg! I'm bringing her around!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I'm coming about!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Why don't we go in? Get another crack at him tomorrow.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: We got a barrel on him. We can't lose him. We stay out here until we find him.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Let's call in -- we can radio and have a big boat here in an hour...

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: You hired me, remember? It's my

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: He's up again.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: That's not so bad. Look at this: ...St. Paddy's Day in Knocko Nolans, in Boston, where some sunovabitch winged me upside the head with a spittoon.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Look here.  Steve Kaplan bit me during recess.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Wire burn. Trying to stop a backstay from taking my head off.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Moray Eel. Bit right through a wet suit.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Face and head scars come from amateur amusements in the bar room. This love line here...  ...that's from some crazy Frenchie come after me with a knife. I caught him with a good right hand right in the snot locker and laid him amongst the sweetpeas.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Ever see one like this?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Bull shark scraped me while I was taking samples...

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Nothing! A pleasure scar. Look here --

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Slammed with a thresher's tail. Look just like somebody caressed me with a nutmeg grater...

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I'll drink to your leg.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: And I'll drink to yours.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Wait a minute, young fella. Look. Just look. Don't touch...

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: ...Mako. Fell out of the tail rope and onto the deck. You don't get bitten by one of those bastards but twice -- your first and your last.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I think I can top that, Mister...

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Gimme a hand, here. I got something to show you --

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: There. Right there. Mary Ellen Moffit broke my heart. Let's drink to Mary Ellen.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: And here's to the ladies. And here's to their sisters; I'd rather one Miss than a shipload of Misters.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Look a' that -- Bayonet Iwo Jima.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: C'mon. Middle appendix --

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: I almost had 'im.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What's that one, there?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Tattoo. Had it taken off.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Don't tell me -- 'Death Before Dishonor.' 'Mother.' 'Semper Fi.' Uhhh... 'Don't Tread on Me.' C'mon -- what?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What's that, a ship?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: You were on the Indianapolis? In '45? Jesus...

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Yeah. The U.S.S. Indianapolis. June 29th, 1945, three and a half minutes past midnight, two torpedoes from a Japanese submarine slammed into our side. Two or three. We was still under sealed orders after deliverin' the bomb...the Hiroshima bomb...we was goin' back across the Pacific from Tinian to Leyte. Damn near eleven hundred men went over the side. The life boats was lashed down so tight to make the bomb run we couldn't cut a single one adrift. Not one. And there was no rafts. None. That vessel sank in twelve minutes. Yes, that's all she took. We didn't see the first shark till we'd been in the water about an hour. A thirteen-footer near enough. A blue. You measure that by judgin' the dorsal to the tail. What we didn't know... of course the Captain knew...I guess some officers knew... was the bomb mission had been so secret, no distress signals was sent. What the men didn't know was that they wouldn't even list us as overdue for a week. Well, I didn't know that -- I wasn't an officer -- just as well perhaps. So some of us were dead already -- in the water -- just hangin' limp in our lifejackets. And several already bleedin'. And the three hundred or so laying on the bottom of the ocean. As the light went, the sharks came crusin'. We formed tight groups -- somewhat like squares in an old battle -- You know what I mean -- so that when one come close, the man nearest would yell and shout and pound the water and sometimes it worked and the fish turned away, but other times that shark would seem to look right at a man -- right into his eyes -- and in spite of all shoutin' and poundin' you'd hear that terrible high screamin' and the ocean would go red, then churn up as they ripped him.  Then we'd reform our little squares. By the first dawn the sharks had taken more than a hundred. Hard for me to count but more than a hundred. I don't know how many sharks. Maybe a thousand. I do know they averaged six men an hour. All kinds -- blues, makos, tigers. All kinds.  Anyway, we delivered the bomb.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What the hell?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: It's a whale out there.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Start the engines.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: He's busting the shaft! Start the pump!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Where...?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: The bilge pumps. There --

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Cut the engines!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Rudder bearings?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Get up forward! Watch for him!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Keep your eyes open, Mr. Hooper!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Nobody sleeps! Nobody.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: More left rudder! More! Left hand down now, Chief.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Lemme get a better angle on it. Now.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: He's bent the housing. You can hear it.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: The barrel!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: It's him.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: He's under the keg. Careful --

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Easy -- just want to goose him up. The minute he runs, drop it or you'll lose your hands.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Here -- gimme. I don't see what he's been doin'.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Shark! Starboard!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Start the engine!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Easy! It'll tear right out!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: The shaft is giving.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: That's it! Radio in for help!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Shut up! Just pump her out!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Yeah, Captain, as soon as I make a call.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Duty first and pleasure after --

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Excuse me!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Some great idea! Now where are we? Some goddamn skipper you are. You're certifiable, y'know that? You're a real treat! Certifiable! Bananas!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Coming right to us!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: No -- comin' right at us! Slow ahead, he'll hit us head on --  Slower! Throttle back ---

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Hard to port!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Try shakin' that out!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Did you get him in the head?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Swing around! After him!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: More gas... go to half! Get me right alongside him --

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: We can't rev it up this high --

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Watch it!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Atta boy!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Take two, they're small!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Don't shoot him any more! He's crazy on his own blood already!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I can't stand here doing nothing!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Order in the court!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Three'll do it! He's havin' trouble with two!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Grab yourselves a couple of poles!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Get ready! Now snag 'em!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Pull in the ropes and tie 'em onto the transom -- free ride.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Get tired! That's the idea! Here's a little reverse for you!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Haul in -- watch the prop!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Now! Untie 'em! Quick! He'll tear us to pieces.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Damn head is too far away. He's too big.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: He can't go so deep. Not with all those on him.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What about us?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Have to pump her steady, s'all.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: You start pumpin' out here.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: No way! He can't!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Where'd he go?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: He can't stay down with three barrels on him! Where is he?!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Have you ever had one do this?

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Follow him!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: He's under!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: There!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: He's trying to sink us!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Dead astern! Zig-zag!

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: He's chasing us! I don't believe it.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Full throttle! To port!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Hold her.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Keep him there! Keep him!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Throttling back!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: What can that gun of yours do?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Power head with 20 ccs of strychnine nitrate. If I can hit him. I can kill him. But I gotta be close. Very close.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: You gotta go in the water...

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Rig the cable to the roof eyebolts.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Take me up.

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Lower away, Chief.  Try and keep him off me till I'm under.

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: Let go of it!

Speaker: quint
Dialogue: He's comin' up -- !

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: He's taken him!

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Quint...?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: No...  You think we can get back with those?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: What day is this?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Wednesday... No, it's Tuesday, I think.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Think the tide's with us?

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: Just keep kicking.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Y'know, I used to hate the water...

Speaker: hooper
Dialogue: I can't imagine why.
